website_summaries.verdict: A popular pair of heated gloves that are perfect to wear during your favorite cold-weather activities, from skiing to motorcycle riding to simply spending time outside in the snow.
pros: Heat up quickly and keep consistent warmth
Have three heat settings to fit different conditions
Material is also warm and stands up well to wind, rain, and snow
cons: Battery life per charge could be better
The claim that they heat fingertips is questionable

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves, could corner the market with an improvement.
customer_reviews.text: I use these in the Seattle area to commute on a motorcycle. Haven't been able to test how wet these get or how long it takes to dry, however down between 40 and 60 degrees these are good. The biggest improvement I would suggest is a way to provide most, or all the warmth to the fingers. Very rarely are your palms colder than your figures. If there was a way to by default include 2X the warming wires in the fingers, or provide 80% of the power here, they would be perfect. As it stands now, any colder than 40ish and I have them on high, baking my palm and back of hand, but barely warming the fingers
customer_reviews.author: Shawn P Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: I use them on my snowmobile and it's nice to be able to turn them on/off easily without ...
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are expensive, but I will say they work very well and seem very well made. I use them on my snowmobile and it's nice to be able to turn them on/off easily without having to stop my sled. I can use my left hand to turn the right glove on (throttle hand) and then tap my left hand on my helmet to turn that glove on/off. There are 3 temps. I was out for most of the day and alternated between low and high and probably got about 4+ hours. Easy to charge too.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heated feature a ripoff
customer_reviews.text: While these gloves might be OK by themselves (but then way too expensive), the heating feature does not work as advertised. Set a medium heat, I was barely able get two hours out of them. So, assuming the batteries were defective I set about trying to contact the maker. First, the well-hidden phone number is not operative. So then I sent an email and after a long wait got a reply saying they would replace the batteries. This went on a number of times with no replacements sent. You are dealing with someone in China here who will not honor their warranty. Stay away!
customer_reviews.author: GliderGuider

customer_reviews.title: Savior vs Volt heated gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Does run small. I wear a women's large and ordered the men's medium. Just fits. I also own a pair of, They are considerably more durable but don't heat as well although their batteries last longer and you can buy batteries with more Ah to last even longer. The Savior gloves are more comfortable but lack the additional inside cuff that blocks air, snow and rain from running down your sleeve and into the glove. For more heat, Savior, for quality, Volt.
customer_reviews.author: DJCTop Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: These gloves run very very small
customer_reviews.text: The sizing information for these gloves is wrong. I typically wear an XL glove and my palm measures 9 1/4 inches around the knuckles. I ordered these gloves in XXL based on another person's review that said they run small, the XXL gloves are still a very snug fit!! I am not sure, but I may return them for an XXXL. I have not worn them outside yet since I may return them, but I have put them on and could feel the heat when turned on high. I think they will help keep my hands warm if I can get gloves that fit well.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R

customer_reviews.title: 100% Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: This is a highly recommended product. I love winter sports but my hands doesn’t. I’ve tried “others” out there. Even the big names-not as good as this! Warmth minus the bulk. The easy to adjust and accessible control that turns red when turned on is my fave. One light the lowest heat,two lights medium heat and three lights max heat! It warms up your fingers ( yes including your thumb). Lightweight. Great for skiing or any winter sports really. Customer service is excellent. I misplaced/lost my charger and emailed them and in less than 24 hours I’m getting a replacement!
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Nice Idea, Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son who works in Material Receiving in Ohio. The winter has been brutal so I thought this would help. The first pair we got we immediately returned because they didn't heat up. The 2nd pair would get him through the first few hours and then they were just gloves. So if you are going to use them to go get the mail or to drive to work and take them off then get these. If you are looking for something to provide your fingers and hand protection from the brutal cold for hours and hours, move on. These ain't them.
customer_reviews.author: Nanea

customer_reviews.title: Good for cool weather not cold weather use
customer_reviews.text: These gloves didn’t get warm enough to ever feel like I needed to turn them down. I used them while cleaning my driveway with my 4 wheeler for about 1.5 hours. Keep them on high the whole time until the batteries died about an hour and fifteen minutes into the job
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you save the battery life then you will love these gloves.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are amazing! Everyone should get a pair! At the top of your hand rather than the palm, but your fingertips do get heated up as well. I went snowboarding last weekend with these gloves and the batteries lasted all day and my hands never got cold. I’d recommend turning on the glove when you need to. If your hands are not cold then don’t waist the battery life. These gloves work even with out the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Aidan Cole

customer_reviews.title: They keep my hands warm in single digit temps
customer_reviews.text: I have Reynaud's syndrome so walking my dog in the winter has always been a painful experience, even with multiple layers of gloves and mittens plus chemical handwarmers. Yesterday we walked for over half an hour at 9 degrees (and windchill of 0) and my gloves kept my hands comfortable the whole time. I've previously tried other heated gloves/mittens that just didn't work for me - too bulky and awkward. I wouldn't say I have a lot of dexterity with these gloves, but enough to handle my dog, shovel snow and fill the bird feeders. I wear a size small in women's gloves and I got an extra small in these.
customer_reviews.author: C. Runnels

customer_reviews.title: I am glad I did
customer_reviews.text: After suffering frostbite while plowing my drive, I wanted to try some heated gloves. I read the reviews and ignored the negative comments on these gloves. I am glad I did. They work very well when only set at the minimum heat level.
customer_reviews.author: Arleymon

customer_reviews.title: batteries are defective
customer_reviews.text: Batteries died after 1 week - wouldn't hold a charge Contacted seller - no response
customer_reviews.author: RF

customer_reviews.title: terrific gloves at great pricer
customer_reviews.text: these gloves are great. i have raynaud’s and ride my bike in temps below 10 F. on full power, these gloves keep my hands from getting too cold. maybe not warm and snug - nothing could do that in those temps, with bike breeze, but comfortable, manageable. they are as good as gerbing gloves which i have also had, but at half the price. and the batteries are 1/3 the size of gerbing batteries, but last just as long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I REALLY like these heated gloves.
customer_reviews.text: I used these about half of the 2017/2018 winter (which BTW was a brutal one)... and I love these gloves. They are not inexpensive but they are well made and work very well for when I'm plowing snow (ATV) or sliding with the kids, etc. I worry sometimes about how long they will last but I really have no reason to as they are working well when I put them away for the season. All in all a good product, a little pricey, but you usually get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Chopper

customer_reviews.title: Warm, comfortable, flexible gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are FANTASTIC! I use them on my motorcycle and they keep my whole hands, including my fingers, warm as toast. They are also flexible enough to easily work all the hand controls, and have a great feel to them.
customer_reviews.author: Fatboy02

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: Daughter has been pleaged by cold hand forever. These gloved have changed her reality... She loves them and skiing more then ever.
customer_reviews.author: John G

customer_reviews.title: Kept my hands warm.
customer_reviews.text: While snow blowing, I usually start to feel my fingers freeze in normal gloves. After 20 or so minutes of temperatures in the single digits to teens, I go into my house with my fingers throbbing. After purchasing these gloves, I was able to snow blow for an hour and half and my fingers and hands were perfectly warm during the entire process. Still have charge left that I used in -20F wind chill today and still kept my hands warm. Money well spent!
customer_reviews.author: coombemj

customer_reviews.title: The glove is awesome and I consider it a high quality purchase
customer_reviews.text: First and foremost after a lot of research, extra batteries can be purchased from Amazon. Follow this link and you get 2 batteries for $35.00. The glove is awesome and I consider it a high quality purchase.
customer_reviews.author: brian phelan

customer_reviews.title: Best gift EVER!!
customer_reviews.text: My 84 year old father insists on plowing his driveway. We live in Michigan, so it gets cold on his John Deere. He complained his fingers and thumbs get cold. He would NEVER buy these for himself, but we decided to splurge a little. He raved about these gloves like a kid with a new toy. He immediately recognized the leather quality and could not be more appreciative. He said his hands are warm, and he can spend more time outside where he's happy. LIFE IS GRAND.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Works !!!
customer_reviews.text: Was a gift for my father who has nerve damage from ice fishing when he was a child . For years his fingers have ached when the winter months come . It's been frustrating for him to not even be able to finish snow blowing the driveway or walk the dog without having to come inside after 20 minutes because his fingers ache . These gloves worked like a charm for him , fingers nice and warm on the medium setting and no aching . Hopefully they will last him a while . They seem well made .
customer_reviews.author: Min

customer_reviews.title: Ah, warm hands!
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves! There were quite a few to choose from on Amazon, but I found these indicated individual fingers would be warmed, not just the palms. Also, customers seemed to like them. Other offerings were just as costly or more, but I found these to provide me warmth as I walk my doggie during the cold Fall/winter days. A good investment by me to a quality manufacturer (at least a week into using the product!).
customer_reviews.author: Fleaker

customer_reviews.title: VERY short battery life!
customer_reviews.text: The gloves unfortunately have a very short battery life. My husband wears them to and from work, totaling 10-15 minutes in total, per day, and they barely make it through the trip home on day two....cannot imagine having to wear them for a couple hours while outdoors. Real shame, as they are great when they work.
customer_reviews.author: Chaya

customer_reviews.title: Battery life as claimed
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because if have Reynauds and ski/board a lot (100+ days a season). On high, these gloves provide about about the same level of heat as the chemical warmers you stick in your gloves, but much more even, meaning your fingers stay warmer, and the battery life is right about what the manufacturer claims i.e. 2.5 hours on high. Works fine for me because I only ever ski half a day, but if you want to go all day these might not do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Hill

customer_reviews.title: Use on Motorcycle in Carolinas: 26F on highway
customer_reviews.text: This glove is wind proof as advertised. I could change the heat level setting by gently pressing against handle grip; point being I don’t need the other hand! Nifty on a running bike. When I rode it felt comfortable and after some use shifting and breaking was easy even with few fingers. Coldest day of the year so I rode to store and on highways at 70-80mph back home. 30+ mins of riding and today I felt the cold but the gloves were fine. No issues with numb fingers and I felt comfortable and in control. I never turned on my handlebar heaters the whole ride. Great gloves!
customer_reviews.author: Balaji Srinivasan

customer_reviews.title: Works well in below freezing temperatures.
customer_reviews.text: I have used these gloves in 27°F or( -3°C ) And i must say it makes a HUGE difference when riding a motorcycle 80mph. Warm without the heat, but if as cold as what i ride in, crank up the heat. My hands swell in the extreem cold, with the gloves my hand hands never sweat either. It seems to be just right. I never feel theeheat when i start riding, yet i never feel the cold either. When i stop, i got to turn the heat to lowest setting, when i ride highest setting. Will update after winter is over for full review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much Needed In the Tree Stand
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are very nice! They are comfortable and very warm. Hunting Opener was very chilly this year and these puppies kept me in the stand longer which gave me more of an opportunity to tag myself a deer. The heating levels 2 and 3 are what you will use most of the time. The low level (level 1) doesn't keep up enough to maintain a good blood flow to the fingers. Level 3 will warm your hands up and then level 2 will maintain it. The battery life is about 2.5-3 hours under continuous use on level 2. I will be buying a couple back-up batteries for next year. Overall is an amazing product, 5/5.
customer_reviews.author: Josiah P.

customer_reviews.title: Work Great!
customer_reviews.text: Got the gloves exactly when they said I would. Plugged in the batteries, charged them up and put them in the gloves this morning. Turned them on, set the temp for medium and proceeded on my 20 mile motorcycle commute in 25 degree weather. They worked great! No cold fingers or discomfort like I get from my normal gauntlet gloves. Much more enjoyable ride! Can't wait to use them for my December 30th New England Patriots game!
customer_reviews.author: Potter

customer_reviews.title: Good quality!
customer_reviews.text: I have now used these gloves for snowmobiling in northern Vermont three times. The XXL gloves fit very nicely! The temps outside were 0-10 degrees. They work so well that all I needed to do was start out on the high setting and once warm I turned them down to the lowest setting. My hands stayed warm and the gloves held a charge for the entire six hour ride. On days when the temps were up around 25 degrees the gloves without heat kept my hands warm and dry. These gloves are a good value and work great ! KP Stamford CT.
customer_reviews.author: Kev Pie

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for cold riding and it came with a ...
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves for cold riding and it came with a nice zippered pouch. Though the first time i went to put the gloves away in the pouch (May) the zipper broke. I emailed the company directly with pictures, asking for a replacement. They stated they'd send me a replacement - never happened.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Kept My Hands Warm at 3 Degrees While Working With Horses
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to work with my horses in northern Arizona. I am now in my 70s and don't have the circulation in my hands that I once had so need glove that work. These did the job even in very low single-digit temps. In the 20s and 30s, I had to set the gloves to a lower setting or they became too warm for my comfort. At the high setting the batteries lasted an hour or two. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Winkler

customer_reviews.title: I should have purchased these years ago!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased them for riding the motorcycle in the winter, but I have also used them for walking the dog and other winter activities. I love them . the XXL fit me nicely and I have been using them for a while now. This is one of those purchases that you make and are so happy that you wish you dad done it years ago. The battery life is good and I can go a few days or a week between charing unless I use them for a long time. I have been using the lowest or middle heat setting typically.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Hubby LOVES these
customer_reviews.text: My hubby is an AVID skier with almost 100 days a year. He skis in ALL weather and we have had some SUPER COLD days this year. Before these gloves, he'd suffer with cold hands. Since these gloves, he skis warm and toasty all day. As many people say, there is no such thing as bad weather -- just bad clothing. Now he has the total ticket for being warm in all sorts of conditions. Lots of his friends -- who paid more $350 - $400 for gloves, complain about fit, quality, on their high-end purchases. But my hubby brags about his. They are pretty darn great!
customer_reviews.author: BreckenridgeGirl

customer_reviews.title: Work pretty well
customer_reviews.text: I bought these since it can get chilly here in Texas when we are riding our bikes. These actually replaced a pair that we returned as they did not keep the fingers warm enough. These are attractive, comfortable and easy to operate. For riding our bikes in the 40s they work well. I suspect real cold (here that would be low 30s) they may not be enough but haven't hit that cold yet. On high we really only get one bike ride (90 minutes) out of charge - there is still juice to be had but not enough for another 90 minutes. Very easy to recharge (and the same charger/batteries as our electric socks so makes it easier).
customer_reviews.author: R. Dempsey

customer_reviews.title: Great for Raynauds sufferers!
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the best gloves I have ever owned. They are made very well and are comfortable and warm even without turning them on. I put mine on medium for my drive to work and back because my fingers turn white as soon as I touch the steering wheel or just get too cold. I live in Minnesota so winters are pretty darn cold. I also tried them while shoveling the driveway and I didn’t have to stop to go in and warm up my hands. These are excellent. I wish they came with extra batteries so I could be out longer though.
customer_reviews.author: Casey F. LaCasse

customer_reviews.title: Very little heat/lackluster service
customer_reviews.text: The Gloves just plain weren’t warm enough. I tried them several times with lackluster results in 0° temperature. For 140 bucks I expected a lot more. I have much better luck with the disposable hand warmers. When I emailed support I was shifted to other departments and eventually told to return them as opposed to receive a new set of batteries which I perceived to be the problem. They just weren’t interested in trying to solve the problem. I’m sending them back won’t buy Savior products anymore.
customer_reviews.author: biasdr

customer_reviews.title: What a life saver!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves work very well. The heat is in the top of the hand and wires go to the finger tips. The size chart worked properly as I do not usually need an XL glove but that's what it said to order and they fit correctly. The button delivers four settings high/med/low/off. On two occasions I have bumped the button and shut a glove off but other than that, I LOVE THESE THINGS! They keep my hands and fingers warm. These are a ski-gloves that you will have to take off to do anything with precision. They are water resistant, not water proof. The battery life has been as rated.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well
customer_reviews.text: My fingers are always cold (Raynaud's) and my doctor suggested these. So far, I've been skiing several times this year which is an activity I gave up many years ago. The gloves keep my hands warm. Fingertips do have some heat on highest setting. It takes a fairly long time to get to temperature (20 minutes or so). Battery life at highest setting is about 4 hours or so. I supplement these with the Hot Hands chemical packs - there is plenty of room. Very satisfied, I will hold off on a 5 star rating until I can judge how many charges the batteries will last.
customer_reviews.author: K.S.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and warm
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are pretty warm even without the heating element. The heating works well, though I wish it was even warmer. When I am riding my scooter, the wind minimizes the amount of heat I feel, but way better than riding with normal gloves.
customer_reviews.author: eligovt

customer_reviews.title: I've always had cold hands; now I can clear ...
customer_reviews.text: I've always had cold hands; now I can clear my driveway without having to come in every 15 minutes to thaw my fingers!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One glove is inoperative
customer_reviews.text: Got these gloves and fully charged the battery as instructed and one glove is completely inoperative
customer_reviews.author: Magdalena

customer_reviews.title: Motorcycling Specific Note
customer_reviews.text: I bought these specifically for cold-weather motorcycling. They have worked as advertised and significantly improve my ability to actually feel and use my fingers when I get off the bike. However, the material on the fingers of the palm side of the glove is rather thick, which can make it hard to work the throttle and clutch precisely. It is possible, certainly, but I find myself opting for thinner gloves and more discomfort when the weather is >35 degrees for safety (my bike has a twitchy throttle). They aren't any thicker than normal ski gloves, but ideally (for motorcycling) they would be thin and warm enough rather than thick and super warm.
customer_reviews.author: B. Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Not Perfect
customer_reviews.text: The gloves do warm the palms and fingers, but I do not think it is worth the price. I was in 30 degree weather and my hands started to get cold and it was on high. The output of heat is not that great. $1 hand warmers would work a lot better . The gloves look to be good quality, but as expected somewhat bulky. Also, since it does not have the special coating on the index finger...you can't use touch screens with them on unless you use a stylus.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Ray

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase this year!
customer_reviews.text: As I have aged it has become more and more difficult to do my barn chores comfortably. With these gloves my hands stay cozy warm. I take the gloves off to open gates and do some not so clean chores (wearing work gloves)...and then I put the warmer gloves back on and my fingers are instantly warm again. Because of the cost, I treat them like gold. I set them in a protected area where I know exactly where they are when I am not wearing them. I think they are worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Faithe Arden

customer_reviews.title: Performance does not equal price
customer_reviews.text: Work well enough 35 degrees and above. But batteries do not last very long. I commute on bike in Boston area 1 hour each way. Batteries last about 2 hours (on high/medium) so I run out of juice at times. Not ideal. Also not ideal for longer winter rides on weekends. Would expect this at a lower price point. But these gloves are rather expensive so would give them 3 stars. Wondering how long batteries will last this long as well as they will degrade over time as all batteries do of course.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Busnach

customer_reviews.title: Fine for normal outdoor activities just not for snowmobiling.
customer_reviews.text: Gloves seemed true to size, comfortable with carry bag. One needs to know that it is only the outside of the glove that is heated not the inside or palm of the hand. Bought these for snowmobiling but wouldn’t use these until I installed hand muffs on the hands grips to keep wind off. I would recommend these for outdoor treks, maybe trail snowshoeing or skiing. Battery life was low when set on highest setting, around 3 hours, enough for most outdoor but not snowmobiling. Batteries last quite a bit longer on the lowest setting that complimented other hand protection. Perfect for normal outdoor activities should be adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Iwejun

customer_reviews.title: Very hot...
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure about these gloves, but took a chance on em. Use them when riding my motorcycle. First time I used them the temp was in the low 30's and I have no fairings on bike to block the wind. I had to turn the gloves down, they were too hot! The lowest setting worked just fine for me. The battery held up for a full day of riding but be careful because its easy to press the 'on' button when storing them in a gear bag/pocket. Easy to charge. Would recommend these gloves. Came on time and as described.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Fits as described, durable, heats even although on low, no heat in the thumbs which is why I purchased them. However on the other settings it does heat thumbs. The fingers produce enough heat to use with touch screens. On low the heat lasts for quite a long time, most of the day. On high ,lasts about 3-4 hours. The power button is on the top of the glove and has led for heat level. The battery fits inside the cuff. Zipped. The recharger is very easy to use. Temps used in. -10 degrees to 30 degrees Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: amazoncustomer5

customer_reviews.title: Good but need a second pair of batterys
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to wait afew weeks before i wrote a review. Im a high lift operator in frozen food so its -20 degrees at work. The gloves at work only work about a hr. So i went heated the first pair cost $35 they werw horrible so i bought these. First they are built well they do ok in -20 not warm but not unbearable cold. Dont think nothing will keep you completely warm in those temps. I like them and work longer with them untill the batterys die which is about 2 and a half hrs. Like the gloves but a second set of batterys r a must
customer_reviews.author: Jackie king

customer_reviews.title: Better off With Hotpacks
customer_reviews.text: Used them in Vermont in 15 degree weather. Kept the setting on 2 to try and conserve the battery. The fingers were not that warm. "1" did nothing. Started just after 9 am and by 1 pm the batteries were totally drained even though had started fully charged. Also in one hand felt like I was getting irritation in one palm. Also in the other index finger felt like there was a seam that I could feel. Returning them. Better off with chemical hotpacks that last all day and you can get by the boxfull at Costco.
customer_reviews.author: FMatt

customer_reviews.title: These Heated Gloves Are Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I have had these gloves for just about a week, and I love them. I use them when I ski. I have Reynaud's syndrome, which means my fingertips get blue when they are cold and they hurt. These gloves are comfortable, warm, and perfect for skiing. I've had other heated gloves, and these are much better. They are a little bulky, but that's because they have so much padding inside. The batteries really heat them up fast. They are good looking, except that the light that shows the battery is on is bright red and shows up on the back of my hand. Oh, well....worth it!
customer_reviews.author: S. L. Case

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, not perfect
customer_reviews.text: On the first pair the index finger was twisted and uncomfortable. Exchanged for another. Second pair was the similar but not as bad. Gloves are comfortable. Work well for snow blowing. My hands get very cold easily and these definitely help with being able to stay out and finish the job. Havent had a problem with battery life. Haven't tested water resistance. Good gloves but would probably try another brand if these break down. Materials seem to get crunchy when its below zero cold.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M.

customer_reviews.title: Warm Hands
customer_reviews.text: We get 4 months of winter weather every year. After reading the reviews, I chose these gloves for their durability, and warmth. These heated gloves kept my hands warm while cleaning snow off my car, and while driving down the road last year, and will do so for a few more years to come. They seem to me to be a better solution than having an expensive heated steering wheel installed. A heated steering wheel would only keep my hands warm while I was driving. I got two spare sets of batteries so I can put already charged spare ones in, plug the low ones in to charge, and go. Yea, warm hands! I hope this helps, NancyP
customer_reviews.author: nan

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: These gloves seemed great well made and thick, even without the heaters. I bought them for mountain biking in between seasons here in Tahoe. Oh, and I have Reynauds, so I suffer easily. I ended up returning these for two reasons, the first is because they're so thick I couldn't manipulate the bars and brakes, shifters, drop post etc. The second is because the battery pack is clunky and on the wrist, so I knew it would smash me when I am bouncing down the track. If I bought them for any other sport I would have kept them.
customer_reviews.author: kevin gregerson

customer_reviews.title: Working in extreme cold.
customer_reviews.text: The work as described. They can get big time hot on the highest setting including fingers. These are very warm gloves even without the heat function. FYI, I live in Chicago.
customer_reviews.author: Teddy

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed glove
customer_reviews.text: Like: Well constructed. Works well if temps are in the double digits. Dislike: Bitter cold/wind and single digits the glove did not keep my hands as warm as I was expecting (on high). The gloves are bulky so even trying to hold a dog leash can be complicated. I do not feel any heat in the palm area of the gloves. The pink fingers tend to not be heated as well as the other finger. Overall they do keep my hands warm. After reading reviews I expected the gloves to be warmed especially when on the high setting.
customer_reviews.author: Mac Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Kept me warm skiing in Canada
customer_reviews.text: I am always cold and use disposable hand warmers even in 30F weather. These are great because you can turn them up and down. They kept me warm in -F weather in Canada. Have never been able to have hands this comfortable skiing until now. Make sure you bring the chargers with you so you can charge them during breaks, if you are going to keep them on high for hours. **Manufacturer should make the ac/dc plug collapse so you can carry in parka pocket.
customer_reviews.author: kmags

customer_reviews.title: Did exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I have only used these gloves 1 time for 7 hours but they were great. I kept them on High while on the chair lift and Low while snowboarding and the battery lasted all day. I have a condition that causes my fingers to lose circulation when cold. These gloves completely saved this from happening. The one thing I cannot tolerate is cold hands. These were a lifesaver. I can not compare them to any other gloves, but I can say I would never need to explore other gloves because I am totally pleased and satisfied with my purchase. I will post an update if there are any issues in the future. For now I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Have poor circulation in my fingers and always hurting after long walks with the dogs in cold weather. These gloves keep your hands warm. Have used them in 5 degree weather for an hour or more and hands never get cold. Take them off to pick up after the dogs and they feel so warm when you put your hands back in. Used their sizing guide by measuring around my hand and they fit perfect. My dogs and I are happy again to take long walks in the cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L. Esterle

customer_reviews.title: WARM HANDS!
customer_reviews.text: First, the gloves are better than all of my expensive ski gloves even without the heat turned on. I have poor circulation to my hands, and these have been awesome for skiing and for shoveling snow. The button to change temp is sensitive, so I've had to be careful to check it and make sure that I haven't bumped it off. Small price to pay for warm hands. Charged according to directions and they work great. I dont know how long it lasts on a charge as I dont spend the entire day in the cold.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara D.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for biking in winter!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves take all the pain out of biking in winter. In 28F (20F windchill) on the lowest setting my hands were perfectly warm. No need for a liner. I bought extra small, which is ok for my hands (6 1/4" wrist to end of middle finger, 7" around palm), although smaller would be better, if they had a smaller size. I can change gears fine, though. I'm very happy with these gloves! Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny M.

customer_reviews.title: Even the XXXL was too snug in the fingers
customer_reviews.text: In fairness, I didn't take the time to use these outdoors. They didn't fit well so being returned. I have long fingers, but not overly big hands. Based on their recommendations, I ordered a size larger due to finger length. I ordered the XXXL size. They are really nice gloves, seem to be well made. But I noticed right away that the fingers were quite snug. After just wearing them around the house for a bit, my fingers were actually getting cold due to lack of circulation, they were that snug. I like the gloves, like the quality. But I'm returning them and ordering mittens instead.
customer_reviews.author: Reed Newman

customer_reviews.title: Good product but my charger didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Loved them when they worked!! But I couldn't figure out why one lasted so much longer than the other. Finally narrowed it down to a faulty lead on the charger--it was reading as full when it wasn't. The battery packs are a bit bulky in the glove and my fingertips were still cold. They are on the right track! Hopefully the design and functionality will continue to evolve. I would've kept them if the battery charger worked but had to return them due to that issue
customer_reviews.author: T23

customer_reviews.title: These work!
customer_reviews.text: My hands get really cold in the wind when shoveling and they sting after a short while from all the years I've spent snowblowing and shoveling in winter. With these gloves I can stay out as long as I want. I've noticed that the very tips of my fingers still get a little cold, but they have been a real help. Got my daughter a pair as well for when she's out with her horses. They are a bit bulky but I have rather small hands and would much rather have bulk than cutting short my time outside.
customer_reviews.author: JeAnne

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: I was commuting to work on my motorcycle. 20 miles in as low as 25F weather, max speed around 60mph. These kept my hands comfortable even that low. I think the leather version would be better but I intended to wear these for snow walks and skiing. They do a good job blocking the wind and the rated heating times are pretty accurate, as far as max temps I cant say. Some negatives- Def not going to be water"proof". To soon to tell about durability So overall for the price I would say these are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Much to thick to do anything. LED extremely bright and distracting.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, these are so thick you can't do anything in them. Fully unable to even close my hands around a rake. They're very heavy as well. Additionally, the LED indicator lights are so bright and distracting you could light the room your in with them. They simply don't need to be so bright. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Ross W Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Savior Heated Gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves great so far but we are not into winter yet. I have cold fingers not sure of the medical term but that is why I purchased them. They do run small as others have listed so buy the next size bigger. I have not gotten a feel for the battery life I will check back in a couple of months when I know.
customer_reviews.author: Rick J

customer_reviews.title: These gloves are amazing
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I would pay this much for a pair of gloves. As a Raynaud’s sufferer, I definitely needed something to help during the cold winters. These gloves are amazing. They appear to be of great quality and are super comfortable. After a quick charge, they have been providing hours of comfort for me. I wear them in the morning when crawling into a cold car and will be wearing them when I have to snowblow or shovel. The heat settings are easy to use and they heat quickly. Good money spent on a good product. BTW, I bought a size larger than I normally do because I used the sizing guide that was online. They fit great!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Shaffner

customer_reviews.title: Great if you work in a freezer warehouse
customer_reviews.text: These are great gloves without even having the heat on, I can go about an hour without having to turn the heat on in a -25°F freezer. Once my hands start to get cold I turn on the max heat for about 5 minutes then down to the lowest setting and it keeps my hands warm until break time. The battery life lasts all day for me too, as long as you don't have them on all day they should last a regular 8-10 hour shift. They're also nimble enough that I can use them with the controls on my forklift and type on a keyboard. I definitely recommend these gloves if you work in a freezer warehouse
customer_reviews.author: Matt C.

customer_reviews.title: Not Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Heaters are very warm and last a decent amount of time. But when the battery runs out the gloves alone are not very warm. Additionally, the heaters do very little when the glove get wet as they are not waterproof. I use these for snowboarding. They are great for a few hours in good cold conditions. However, all day on a mountain and an ice/rain storm were too much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hot gloves that really work
customer_reviews.text: I had another pair of heated gloves that just didn't do the job. The heat was in the palms not the fingers. They also were too thin to keep my hands fingers warm. These Savor heated Gloves do the trick. I bought an extra set of batteries. The batteries last on the highest setting for about 3 1/2 hours. I haven't tested on lower setting because I need the heat of the highest setting. I think these are the best heated gloves on the market.
customer_reviews.author: dennis w wygal

customer_reviews.title: Warm!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these hopping to find a pair that would keep my hands warm during the cold weather (I have not found a pair that will keep my fingers from freezing!!!) I was very pleased that they keep my hands AND fingers warm while on the lowest setting!!! I spent several hours in 0 degree weather and did not have cold hands the whole time!! Batteries are easy to charge and last a long time! Very happy with these!!
customer_reviews.author: M. S. Lauer

customer_reviews.title: Cold Hands?  Try these!
customer_reviews.text: I have serious issues with Rahynod’s syndrome, which means my fingers turn white and then purple after a short time outside in the cold. I have tried EVERY pair of gloves I’ve seen, but nothing helped. This gloves have been the best ones I’ve ever tried. They are bulky, so you can’t pick up much of anything with them on, but they keep my hands warm, and my fingers pink! So far they have been worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: L. Hardin

customer_reviews.title: Worked great all season
customer_reviews.text: As long as you are aware that these gloves heat only the top of your hand and fingers, you should be satisfied. In many cases they did not need to be turned on to keep your hands warm. When things got a bit chilly, turning them on for a couple of minutes was enough to get things warm again. When riding on the highway in very cold weather, the palms and fingertips got a bit cold but never uncomfortably so..
customer_reviews.author: Gregory A. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, mostly nonfunctional within weeks
customer_reviews.text: I have Raynaud's and was looking for something that would withstand commuting 60min RT each day to work in San Francisco, where it rarely drops below 40F but does get wet and windy. Within 2 weeks, I felt wires within the fingers failing and going cold when the gloves are turned on. Now, having worn them about 6-7 weeks, many of the wires throughout the gloves have died and battery life has diminished. I'll be contacting the company's customer service for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: Good quality overall but leather grip material could be better.
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of battery powered heated gloves. They work as expected and during -30 degree wind chill during the polar vortex they kept my hands warm. They only gripe I have is that the leather grip seems lesser quality and over a year probably will dry and crack just like the cheaper made gloves without heat. That part is disappointing because of the cost and all of the other parts of this glove which is of higher quality. I don’t regret the purchase just not 5 star because I know in a year or two they will need to be replaced only because of the leather grip cracking due to time.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: warm hands
customer_reviews.text: Savior Heated Gloves for Men Women, Skiing Heated Gloves,Arthritis Gloves have been wonderful. I suffer from cold hands ...even indoors, and I have used the gloves not only out doors in the Massachusetts winter, but also indoors when my hands decide arbitrarily to feel very cold. The gloves heat up gradually and make my hands feel nrmal again. 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Strang

customer_reviews.title: Best gloves I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a pair of gloves that work as advertised. I suffer from Reynaud's Syndrome and my hands are always cold. I took a chance on the Saviors, as they were not cheap. But, they are absolutely worth every penny. Love them and I highly recommend them to anyone who wants to keep their hands warm in the coldest of weather.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Raiche

customer_reviews.title: GREAT purchase for those of us living in the upper Midwest!
customer_reviews.text: It's not even winter in Wisconsin yet and already I have used these battery operated heated gloves and LOVE them! I am an avid cyclist and ride my bike until the snow flies early in the morning when it is 35 degrees outside. These gloves keep my hands warm during the entire time of me being out on my bike! They have three settings, and the rechargeable battery life is TWO hours! These will be perfect when I am out shoveling and snow blowing this winter! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Bobbymke

customer_reviews.title: They keep his fingers nice and toasty
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband to use while on the tractor in freezing weather. They keep his fingers nice and toasty.
customer_reviews.author: Marla

customer_reviews.title: good looking
customer_reviews.text: This is a well make quality glove. I bought these for riding my motorcycle during the winter months here in Arkansas. Our 3 months of winter, 12,1,2 can be 25 to 45 during the morning hours and so far I have ridden in both temps.. My fingers have been pleased with the gloves so far. They also are comfortable without heat at 60 degrees and 65 mph. Would the $400. be better, will never know. These fit my budget, are well made and I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: Brock

customer_reviews.title: Sizing was accurate
customer_reviews.text: After reading some reviews that stated these run small, I ordered the extra large and I usually take a large. They are a little lose but that worked out well as I had to take one off many times when I needed my fingers for intricate work. They lasted 5-6 hours on medium setting and my thumbs stayed warm too. Some other brands do not work as well on the thumbs. Glad I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: James D. Eliassen

customer_reviews.title: Work as described.
customer_reviews.text: I like the gloves. They fit was what I expected. They are nice and warm on the high setting. All the fingers, thumb and back of hand have heaters. I don't notice much warmth on the low setting. Some people have complained about the bright red lights on the gloves when they are on. I don't mind as I don't notice them in the day light, and they make me much more visible to traffic at night. I haven't run the batteries dry yet, so I can't speak to run time. Over all I'm pleased. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory P.

customer_reviews.title: Good but didn't last more than one season
customer_reviews.text: 1 year update. Used this gloves during 2018/19 winter almost every day, while biking in the snow for about an hour during my commute. They worked fine and kept me warm. However, one this second winter the gloves are having some problems they don't warm up as much as they did last year and they keep shutting down even if the battery is fully charged. I asked the company about a possible solution but their response was: "we have a one year warranty, you bought it in 14 months ago". So that's it. I liked the product, but for the price (~$150) I was expecting a little more. There might be better options out there. Ciao!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great investment to keep hands warm during winter!
customer_reviews.text: Love these glove. I should have bought these years ago to avoid the cold fingers/ hands which I have through out winter months. I used to wear double non-heated gloves and still my fingers were cold. These heated gloves kept my fingers / hands warm for the hour it took me to shovel the snow and also while driving. Great investment and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Paresh Shah

customer_reviews.title: I love the gloves
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product what the 1st time in 27 years my hands did not freeze while I was working outside at night. There are only 3 things that I can find wrong with this product. First there is no indication of how much power Indicator Second you have to remove the glove in order to manipulate a cell phone. Third MY biggest complaint of all is that they are not waterproof
customer_reviews.author: Eric Espinoza

customer_reviews.title: Great for our snowy winter
customer_reviews.text: I live at 7200 feet up in the Rockies and have used my wonderful heated gloves to keep me toasty warm this winter shoveling out 6 1/2 feet of snow in single digit temperatures all winter. They work perfectly, with 3 heat settings so you can adjust the heat. The fit well and are tough. They are a bit heavy due to the battery packs but the battery life is good. I would recommend them and buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Cowgirl

customer_reviews.title: They are exactly as promised.
customer_reviews.text: I am so thankful I bought these for my husband. He can ride his motorcycle in temps that he couldn’t before and I used them to shovel when it was -1 degree the other day and they were wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: P. Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Rugged, Warm
customer_reviews.text: Just finished using these gloves for an entire Duck Hunting Season in harsh conditions. My wife bought these with the socks by same company. The gloves use the battery up a little faster than the socks (but still several hours of heat). Best to use on the medium setting for best range of operation and warmth. I wish they were waterproof, but they ARE very water resistant, work even when damp and if soaking wet I simply air dry gloves and battery and they go back to normal operating condition. Definitely windproof and heating elements well disbursed. Rugged construction.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Savior Heated Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I waited until I used these gloves a few times before writing a review. They DO keep your hands warm. I ride a motorcycle and cold fingers are not fun. The Savior heated gloves heat the OUTSIDE of your hands, keeping the core warm. I recommend them for rides under two hours, as the battery life is a little disappointing on HIGH. 2 hours is pretty much all they will last until the blinking light, indicating low battery, comes on. I will buy an extra set of batteries before making a long ride in the cold weather. Overall, I would recommend them. It sure beats riding with hypothermic hands and fingers.
customer_reviews.author: uwhunter

customer_reviews.title: Great product but very poor battery life on high heat
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for cold weather hunting as I have very bad circulation problems from cancer treatments. I was In about 25 degree weather and found they worked very well, BUT the battery life on the high setting was about 2 hrs with full charges. I need more power, they skimped on the battery, so it seems.
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: Need to stay on top of charging if using on max.
customer_reviews.text: I have abnormally cold hands and I live in Minnesota. These allowed me to actually go out in the cold and wait at bus stops in the morning with no issue. Just stay on top of charging them, with my hands I find I mostly have to run them in max unless it's like 40 or so degrees out than I can get away with low or medium. Biggest complaint would be the red led lights, I'd rather not look like iron Man in the dark. If these could have a stealth mode to turn them off that'd be nice.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Work just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my wife for skiing. She's skied three days with them so far in pretty chilly weather (mid-teens to low 20s with wind) and they have kept her hands nicely warm. Last time out, the batteries died before the end of the day. However, we skied only another run or two and that was fine. Removing the batteries, charging them, and reconnecting them are all very simple steps. My wife like the construction of the gloves, finds them comfortable, and they do what she wanted them to do - keep her hands warm.
customer_reviews.author: GF

customer_reviews.title: They are still working as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Been through thirteen ~1 hr cycles on High with ambient temp of 30-40F and sustained winds of +20 mph (Paramotoring). They are warm under these conditions. Bulky but provide enough dexterity to operate touch screen on my phone. XXXL fits 10" circumference palms with a little wiggle room (not too snug). I would agree the battery connectors seem a bit frail: I shall treat them w/care.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Coron

customer_reviews.title: The best heated gloves I've ever bought!
customer_reviews.text: I have small hands, I bought a medium because of other reviews. They work, a little lose, but that doesn't bother me. I love the three levels of heat. I ride when the temp gets to 40°. I put them on high and my always cold fingers do great! Better than investing in heated hand grips that only keep your palms warm. I highly recommend these!!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Warm and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my wife for a birthday present. She does a lot of walking and her hands get cold. These gloves heat up quickly and are very comfortable to wear. Have not had a chance to test their water resistance, but they appear to be constructed in such a way that I do not believe it will be any problem when they are tested. Very well-made.
customer_reviews.author: B.A.

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye Reynauds
customer_reviews.text: My husband has to be outside a lot for work and in MN that's challenging as he has developed Reynauds. These worked really well and the battery lasted for as long as he needed it to. The only reason they didn't get a 5 is b/c when it did get really REALLY cold (-20) they didn't do much more than having those disposable chemical heat packets.
customer_reviews.author: elph

customer_reviews.title: Keeping me warm for hours!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are amazing! They keep my hands warm even on the lowest setting! They also can last more tha 6 hours if kept on the lowest setting the whole time. I work outside for 8 hours at least sometimes in single digit temperatures. I am so glad I bought these gloves from savior. Also the iPad touch works very well! Better on phone than iPad but works on both!
customer_reviews.author: will

customer_reviews.title: They are quite warm!! Yesssssss
customer_reviews.text: These heat up very well and stay warm the entire time. I recharge after about 2 full hours of use on the highest setting. The touch screen functionality isn’t very good but it doesn’t bother me. Also, they are not very water resistant. These gloves should be purchased for their warmth factor and that’s it. Other, less expensive gloves do not get as warm as these. Spend the extra money and be glad you did when you wear them in the cold!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A Pirozzolo

customer_reviews.title: There is no touch "screen". The control buttons are easily accessed and responsive
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because of trouble keeping my hands warm when skiing while temperatures are in the teens and 20's. So far, I am pleased with their performance. I only got one season out of my last pair of battery-powered ski gloves and decided to try this brand. Only half-way through this year's ski season so we'll see if they last!
customer_reviews.author: John A.

customer_reviews.title: A satisfied motorcycle rider
customer_reviews.text: I wore this for the first time this morning on the way to work. The temperature was 39° with a mist falling. I was riding at full interstate speed, 70 mph, and had the gloves on medium. My hands and fingers never felt the cold or the mist. They were not too hot, or too cold, it was just right for this ride. I am in between sizes according to the size chart. I chose the larger size, however it is a bit large on my hand but manageable overall. In hindsight I would probably choose the smaller size. Overall I am very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: suprvulcan

product_meta.title: Savior Heated Gloves for Men Women, Electric Heated Gloves,Heated Skiing Gloves and Snowboarding Gloves
product_meta.description:
If you've struggled to find gloves that keep your hands warm in bitter winter weather, turn to the Savior Heated Mitts. These gloves have everything you will need to brave the toughest weather conditions. 
Innovatively designed, these premium full finger gloves gently warm the entire length of each finger, back of the hand, keeping your hands nice and toasty even when battling freezing temperatures. 
Durable and Comfortable - We’ve used premium grade materials to give these gloves the durability, however, doesn’t come at the expense of comfort. The gloves have a breathable membrane and soft lining. 
You’re in for a comfy experience even with prolonged wear; no more dealing with sweaty hands

FAQ

Q1: I don’t know how to get it work 
When batteries are installed the glove, Press ON/OFF button first time, the heat setting to high (3 light bars will illuminate) 
Press ON/OFF button a second time to reduce the heat setting to Medium (2 light bars will illuminate) 
Press ON/OFF button a third time to reduce the heat setting to low (1 light bars will illuminate) 
Press ON/OFF button of fourth time to turn glove heat system off (all light bars will shut off) 

Q2: Can i machine wash the gloves? 
We do not recommend you use machine wash, machine wash will damage the inside heated element. Spot clean gloves by hand using only mild detergent. 

Q3: Gloves only heats for about 30 minutes then went off when i first use it. 
Most of batteries won’t come in fully charged status so that’s why you need to recharge them for at least 4 hours when you receive it. 

Q4: Does it work under subzero area? 
Yes, it does. Enjoy extra warmth on your hands no matter what you're doing outside
feature_bullets: 【High Quality Material】 The external layer of the cycling gloves is made of 40% lambskin and 60% polyester, breathable, waterproof and wind resistant. And the internal part made of soft pearl cotton insulation layer includes imported heat elements and a pair of 2200mAh rechargeable lithium-ion batteries to keep your hands warm. The back has a carbon fiber protective shell for protecting your joints. Buckle-style hook and loop fastener on the cuffs is designed for easy adjustment

【3 Temperature Settings & Instant Heat】 Equipped with three different heat settings - high, middle, low, you can control the temperature of the motorcycle gloves easily. 3 heated settings system can provide most appropriate warmth for people in need. You can feel obviously your hands warmer when turning on the gloves in 30 seconds.

【Excellent Warm Function】 The battery-powered rechargeable gloves provide a wide heating area covering your whole back of hand and all fingers in case of poor blood circulation, arthritis, cold weather, or simply for more comfort and warmth.

【Perfect For Outdoor Sports】 The arthritis gloves for men and women are perfect for a variety of outdoor sports in cool or chilly days, especially ideal for running, cycling, hiking, skating, camping, snow skiing, fishing, hunting etc.

【Quality Assurance】 All Savior Heat brand heated gloves are 1 year quality assurance. If you have any questions about quality, please feel free to contact us and we will solve your problem quickly until you are satisfied.
